conclusion: To determine which container (E, F, or G) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles, we need to analyze the paths created by the obstructions.
The blue liquid starts at A and flows downward.
The blue liquid encounters the green bar, which directs it left.
The blue liquid continues down and moves into container F.
The orange liquid starts at B and flows downward.
The orange liquid encounters the gray bar, which directs it right.
The orange liquid continues down and moves into container G.
The yellow liquid starts at C and flows downward.
The yellow liquid encounters the purple bar, which directs it right.
The yellow liquid continues down and moves into container G.
The pink liquid starts at D and flows downward.
The pink liquid encounters the black bar, which directs it right.
The pink liquid continues down and moves into container G.
The step-by-step analysis shows that the blue liquid flows into container F, while the orange, yellow, and pink liquids flow into container G.
Final Answer: A: F, B: G, C: G, D: G.
